III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following: (a) Routine
and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral health care.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns that a pregnant youth is not receiving proper
prenatal care.
Investigation Interviews:
On 05/09/2024 it was noted Complainant for this investigation is
anonymous.
On 05/09/2024 an email was sent to Foster Care Worker (FCW)
advising of Youth A’s involvement in the special investigation.
On 05/09/2024 an onsite visit was made to Vista Maria to initiate
the investigation.
On 05/09/2024 an in-person meeting was held at Vista Maria with
Consumer Rights Officer (CRO). He was advised of the
allegation and a request was made to see Youth A. CRO advised
that Youth A is currently pregnant and due in July 2024. She had
her last OB/GYN appointment on May 2, 2024. He denied being
aware of any concerns related to Youth A not making any of her
scheduled prenatal appointments.
On 05/09/2024 an in-person interview was held at Visita Maria
with Youth A. She denied the agency had failed to take her to
scheduled prenatal appointments. She reported she has made it
to all of her appointments. She further reported the staff are very
responsive to her needs and do their best to make sure she is
comfortable.
On 05/31/2024 an in-person interview was held with Youth B and
Youth C at Vista Maria. Both youth denied any knowledge of
youth not being taken to scheduled or unscheduled medical
appointments.
On 05/31/2024 an in-person interview was held with Team Leader
at Visita Marta. She denied any knowledge of Youth A not being
transported for her medical appointments. She reported she
believes Youth A has made all of her scheduled appointments.
On 05/31/2024 an in-person interview was held with Nurse
Manager. She confirmed Youth A had a total of 7 off campus
prenatal appointments, and she attended them all. Youth A did
have one dental appointment that she was unable to make and
had to reschedule.
2

Documents Reviewed: 12 individual medical documentation
notes confirming that Youth A attended off campus prenatal and
ObGYN appointments. Dates included 2/15, 2/20, 2/22, 3/2, 3/21,
4/18, 5/2, 5/6 and 5/23.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was no information to
support that the agency failed to ensure Youth A made her
prenatal appointments. Youth A reported she made all of her
appointments and the Nurse Manager also confirmed attendance
at all medical appointments.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Youth nutrition
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149
Section (2) Meals shall be of sufficient quantity to meet the nutritional
Description allowances recommended by USDA
guidelines:(www.healthierus.gov/dietaryguidelines)
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns that a pregnant youth is not getting adequate
nutrition.
Investigation Interview:
On 05/09/2024 an in-person meeting was held at Vista Maria with
Consumer Rights Officer (CRO). He was advised of the
allegation and a request was made to see Youth A. He denied
being aware of any concerns related to Youth A not receiving
enough food or food that did not provide necessary nutrition. On
05/31/2024 another in-person interview was held at Visita Maria
with CRO. He provided information regarding the meal plans and
the rotation of the posting of the menu at the facility. He again
denied knowledge of any youth reporting that they do not receive
enough food or that the food is not nutritional.
On 05/09/2024 an in-person interview was held at Visita Maria
with Youth A. She reported that she is provided three meals a
day at the facility and also receives snacks. Youth A added that
staff will try to supplement her portions since they are aware that
she is eating for two. On 05/31/2024 another in-person interview
was held at Visita Maria with Youth A. Youth A reported she is
provided three meals per day, plus snacks. She was asked why
anyone would think she does not get sufficient food and she
3

responded she did not know. She stated she feels very confident
with the food options and is never hungry at the facility.
On 05/31/2024 an in-person interview was held with Youth B and
Youth C. Both youth reported receiving three meals per day, in
addition to snacks. Both youth also confirmed that the meal
schedule is posted and they are able to view it whenever they like.
On 05/31/2024 an in-person interview was held with Team Leader
at Visita Maria. She confirmed that residents are provided three
meals per day, plus snacks. She further added that a schedule is
utilized for meal prep to provide for variety and nutritional choices.
Documents Reviewed: Visita Maria Monthly Menu and schedule
documented that appropriate meals are scheduled three times per
day, in addition to snacks.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation there was no information to
support that Youth A was not receiving sufficient nutrition and
food. A total of three youth were interviewed and they all reported
receiving three meals per day based on the posted meal
schedule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
